title: Horticultural Science Problem-Based Learning (PBL) Program for Enhancing Field Problem-Solving Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Horticulture Theory, Practical Experience, and Project Management Experience
context.additional_context: Practical Training for Horticulture Department Managers/Leaders in Organizations, Emphasizing Real-World Workplace Integration, with Smartphone-Enabled Resource Sharing and Collaboration

learning_goals: Apply the PBL (Problem-Based Learning) process to establish and execute project plans for solving complex horticultural problems.
Apply conflict management, leadership, and communication skills to real-world cases through team-based collaboration.
Cultivate the ability to resolve unpredictable problems arising during the design and operation of horticultural production systems.
Acquire field-applicable technical skills through crop cultivation projects (leafy greens/seedling production).
Enhance self-directed learning abilities through reflective journaling and feedback.

resources: Horticulture practice equipment (greenhouse, growing soil, seeds, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
